body.p: The subsidiary does not have an obligation to settle the transaction with its employees. Therefore, the subsidiary shall account for the transaction with its employees as equity‑settled, and recognise a corresponding increase in equity as a contribution from its parent. The subsidiary shall remeasure the cost of the transaction subsequently for any changes resulting from non‑market vesting conditions not being met in accordance with paragraphs 19–21. This differs from the measurement of the transaction as cash‑settled in the consolidated financial statements of the group.
